## Description {#details}

Target-Independent Code Generator <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> Configuration Options.

This is an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/immutablepass">ImmutablePass</a> solely for the purpose of exposing CodeGen options to the internals of other CodeGen passes.

Definition at line 85 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h">TargetPassConfig.h</a>.

### addMachinePasses() {#a821092b65a0bd12e6aab341164fd4e93}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void TargetPassConfig::addMachinePasses ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Add the complete, standard set of LLVM CodeGen passes.

Add the complete set of target-independent postISel code generator passes.

Fully developed targets will not generally override this.

This can be read as the standard order of major LLVM CodeGen stages. Stages with nontrivial configuration or multiple passes are broken out below in addStage routines.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> TargetPassConfig::addXX routine may be overriden by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a>. The addPre/Post methods with empty header implementations allow injecting target-specific fixups just before or after major stages. Additionally, targets have the flexibility to change pass order within a stage by overriding default implementation of addStage routines below. Each technique has maintainability tradeoffs because alternate pass orders are not well supported. addPre/Post works better if the target pass is easily tied to a common pass. But if it has subtle dependencies on multiple passes, the target should override the stage instead.

TODO: We could use a single addPre/Post(ID) hook to allow pass injection before/after any target-independent pass. But it&#39;s currently overkill.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h/#l00301">301</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h">TargetPassConfig.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/targetpassconfig-cpp/#l01107">1107</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/targetpassconfig-cpp">TargetPassConfig.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### addILPOpts() {#a3c584af6befa438063622f975dc8386a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual bool llvm::TargetPassConfig::addILPOpts ()"
  labels = {["inline", "protected", "virtual"]}>
Add passes that optimize instruction level parallelism for out-of-order targets.

These passes are run while the machine code is still in SSA form, so they can use <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinetracemetrics">MachineTraceMetrics</a> to control their heuristics.

All passes added here should preserve the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinedominatortree">MachineDominatorTree</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineloopinfo">MachineLoopInfo</a>, and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinetracemetrics">MachineTraceMetrics</a> analyses.

### addPass() {#a2e61a629981e27e1e084a07dd953dcb5}

  labels = {["protected"]}>
Add a pass to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passmanager">PassManager</a> if that pass is supposed to be run, as determined by the StartAfter and StopAfter options.

Add a pass to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passmanager">PassManager</a> if that pass is supposed to be run.

Takes ownership of the pass.

If the Started/Stopped flags indicate either that the compilation should start at a later pass or that it should stop after an earlier pass, then do not add the pass. Finally, compare the current pass against the StartAfter and StopAfter options and change the Started/Stopped flags accordingly.

### addPreRewrite() {#a7a0137211a0b4a9400f319412dad626a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual bool llvm::TargetPassConfig::addPreRewrite ()"
  labels = {["inline", "protected", "virtual"]}>
addPreRewrite - Add passes to the optimized register allocation pipeline after register allocation is complete, but before virtual registers are rewritten to physical registers.

These passes must preserve <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/virtregmap">VirtRegMap</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals">LiveIntervals</a>, and when running after RABasic or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ragreedy">RAGreedy</a>, they should take advantage of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix">LiveRegMatrix</a>. When these passes run, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/virtregmap">VirtRegMap</a> contains legal physreg assignments for all virtual registers.

Note if the target overloads addRegAssignAndRewriteOptimized, this may not be honored. This is also not generally used for the fast variant, where the allocation and rewriting are done in one pass.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h/#l00432">432</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h">TargetPassConfig.h</a>.

### createRegAllocPass() {#a521c0fd2e8307b5b136c2e8b984a9316}

  labels = {["protected", "virtual"]}>
addMachinePasses helper to create the target-selected or overriden regalloc pass.

Find and instantiate the register allocation pass requested by this target at the current optimization level.

Different register allocators are defined as separate passes because they may require different analysis.

This helper ensures that the regalloc= option is always available, even for targets that override the default allocator.

  labels = {["protected", "virtual"]}>
createTargetRegisterAllocator - Create the register allocator pass for this target at the current optimization level.

Instantiate the default register allocator pass for this target for either the optimized or unoptimized allocation path.

This will be added to the pass manager by addFastRegAlloc in the unoptimized case or addOptimizedRegAlloc in the optimized case.

A target that uses the standard regalloc pass order for fast or optimized allocation may still override this for per-target regalloc selection. But -regalloc=... always takes precedence.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h/#l00409">409</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h">TargetPassConfig.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/targetpassconfig-cpp/#l01363">1363</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/targetpassconfig-cpp">TargetPassConfig.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Private Member Functions

### setStartStopPasses() {#a0129280d6e20bae9a32f6e592263d07a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void TargetPassConfig::setStartStopPasses ()">
Set the StartAfter, StartBefore and StopAfter passes to allow running only a portion of the normal code-gen pass sequence.

If the StartAfter and StartBefore pass ID is zero, then compilation will begin at the normal point; otherwise, clear the Started flag to indicate that passes should not be added until the starting pass is seen. If the Stop pass ID is zero, then compilation will continue to the end.

This function expects that at least one of the StartAfter or the StartBefore pass IDs is null.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h/#l00120">120</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetpassconfig-h">TargetPassConfig.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/targetpassconfig-cpp/#l00446">446</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/targetpassconfig-cpp">TargetPassConfig.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
